rule: Each output must strictly adhere to the capitalization format provided, with all part-of-speech tags written in uppercase, and both "Unknown" and "CantAnswer" written in sentence capitalization as specified.
validityText:
The input is a JSON-like structure with two keys: "sentence" and "word". The sentence is "La porte est grande ouverte.", which appears to be a grammatically valid French sentence. It does not contain any special characters or symbols that are not part of normal linguistic usage. The word is "grande", which is a substring of the sentence. The word does not include punctuation. All the requirements of the input specification are met.
OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output provides a part-of-speech tag, but it utilizes "ADJECTIVE" instead of the specified tags like "JJ", "JJR", or "JJS". This is a direct violation of the instruction to return only the tags listed in the description.
ERR
